## Classes Index

<MembersIndex>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer">MemoryBuffer</a></>}>
This interface provides simple read-only access to a block of memory, and provides simple methods for reading files and standard input into a memory buffer. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/writablememorybuffer">WritableMemoryBuffer</a></>}>
This class is an extension of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer">MemoryBuffer</a>, which allows copy-on-write access to the underlying contents. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/writablememorybuffer/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/writethroughmemorybuffer">WriteThroughMemoryBuffer</a></>}>
This class is an extension of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer">MemoryBuffer</a>, which allows write access to the underlying contents and committing those changes to the original source. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/writethroughmemorybuffer/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

</MembersIndex>

<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This interface provides simple read-only access to a block of memory, and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// provides simple methods for reading files and standard input into a memory</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// buffer.  In addition to basic access to the characters in the file, this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// interface guarantees you can read one character past the end of the file,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// and that this character will read as &#39;\\0&#39;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The &#39;\\0&#39; guarantee is needed to support an optimization -- it&#39;s intended to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// be more efficient for clients which are reading all the data to stop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// reading when they encounter a &#39;\\0&#39; than to continually check the file</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// position to see if it has reached the end of the file.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This class is an extension of MemoryBuffer, which allows copy-on-write</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// access to the underlying contents.  It only supports creation methods that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// are guaranteed to produce a writable buffer.  For example, mapping a file</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This class is an extension of MemoryBuffer, which allows write access to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the underlying contents and committing those changes to the original source.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// It only supports creation methods that are guaranteed to produce a writable</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// buffer.  For example, mapping a file read-only is not supported.</span></CodeLine>
